reasoning: Metastatic Wilms tumor is a subtype of Wilms tumor (nephroblastoma) presenting with distant metastases at diagnosis. Overall Wilms tumor incidence ~8-10 per 100k children globally; approximately 5-15% present with metastatic disease. Estimated metastatic Wilms tumor incidence ~0.15 per 100k children (0.01-0.02 per 100k general population).
source: Coppes MJ et al. (1999). Wilms' tumor. Lancet. 349(9058):1149-1152
